question: When trying to create an S3 bucket named documents, AWS informs you that the bucket name is already in use. What should you do in order to create a bucket?
answer: Use a globally unique bucket name.

question: Which S3 storage classes are most cost-effective for infrequently accessed data that can’t be easily replaced? (Type TWO.)
What are the major differences between Simple Storage Service (S3) and Elastic Block Store (EBS)? (Type TWO.)
Which tasks can S3 object life cycle configurations perform automatically? (Type THREE.)

options.option: Moving objects to an EBS volume

question: What methods can be used to grant anonymous access to an object in S3? (Type TWO.)

Your budget-conscious organization has a 5 TB database file it needs to retain off-site for at least 5 years. In the event the organization needs to access the database, it must be accessible within 8 hours. Which cloud storage option should you recommend, and why? (Type TWO.)

options.option: S3 has the most durable storage.
Glacier is the most cost effective.
S3 has the fastest retrieval times.
S3 doesn’t support object sizes greater than 4 TB.

question: Which of the following actions can you perform from the S3 Glacier service console?
Which Glacier retrieval option generally takes 3 to 5 hours to complete?
What’s the minimum size for a Glacier archive?
Which types of AWS Storage Gateway let you connect your servers to block storage using the iSCSI protocol? (Type TWO.)
Where does AWS Storage Gateway primarily store data?

You need an easy way to transfer files from a server in your data center to S3 without having to install any third-party software. Which of the following services and storage protocols could you use? (Type FOUR.)
Which of the following are true regarding the AWS Storage Gateway—volume gateway configuration? (Type THREE.)

options.option: Stored volumes asynchronously back up data to S3 as EBS snapshots.
Stored volumes can be up to 32 TB in size.
Cached volumes locally store only a frequently used subset of data.
Cached volumes asynchronously back up data to S3 as EBS snapshots.
Cached volumes can be up to 32 TB in size.

question: What’s the most data you can store on a single Snowball device?
Which of the following are security features of AWS Snowball? (Type TWO.)

options.option: It uses a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip.

question: Which might AWS do after receiving a damaged Snowball device from a customer?
answer: Securely erase the customer’s data from the device

question: Which can you use to transfer data to AWS Snowball from a Windows machine without writing any code?
How do the AWS Snowball and Snowball Edge devices differ? (Type TWO.)

options.option: Snowball Edge supports copying files using NFS.
Snowball devices can be clustered together for storage.
Snowball’s QSFP+ network interface supports speeds up to 40 Gbps.
Snowball Edge can run EC2 instances.

question: Which of the following Snowball Edge device options is the best for running machine learning applications?
Which of the following hardware devices offers a network interface speed that supports up to 100 Gbps?
answer: Snowball Edge with the Compute Optimized configuration
